https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.teacher_markdown:
**IMPORTANT:**  This story is meant to be read aloud by a teacher interacting with the class.  Find the PDF at [https://goo.gl/q2BQ1a][0] .   

* * *

If you are unable to read the story to your class, please be sure to ask students about this video. The intention is _not_ to have students passively watch!

Q1) In this story, what do "bugs" do?

Q2) In computer science, programmers talk about having "bugs" in their code.  What do you think that means?

Q3) How did Jasmine and JD find the bugs that they were looking for?

Q4) Can you remember this way of looking for bugs?

-   Walk through step-by-step.
-   Is everything good at the first step?
-   Is everything good at the second step?
-   The third?
-   If you find something wrong, look around that place for the "bug".
-   When you find the bug, give it a name, and say it out loud!

**IMPORTANT:**  This story is meant to be read aloud by a teacher interacting with the class.  Find the PDF at [https://goo.gl/SZHo4z][0] .   

* * *

If you are unable to read the story to your class, please be sure to ask students about this video. The intention is _not_ to have students passively watch! 

Q1) What two big words did Stevie learn in this story?

Q2) What does it mean to be "frustrated"?

Q3) Have you ever been frustrated?

Q4) What are some things that you can do when you feel yourself getting frustrated?

Q5)  What is "persistence"?

Q6) Why is persistence a good thing?

Q7) What are some things you can do to help yourself be persistent?

**Free Play:** Move Laurel around and get as much treasure as you can. Get at least one item with no mistakes to pass this level.  

* * *

Drag blocks into the workspace and try to figure out how to get treasure.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.short_instructions: This is a new type of puzzle called "Artist". Play with the level and draw something fun.
The Artist is trying to draw a line **6** times, but can't get it right.  Can you help?

authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops2_a: If you want the loop to repeat more than 4 times, you can change the number at the top of the block.

callouts.courseB_artist_loops3_1: There is only one of these blocks in the toolbox.  How will you use it?

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.short_instructions: Now we need to get the soil ready to plant. Find the bugs in the code and help the artist prepare the ground.

authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops4_a: The jump block lets you move forward without drawing a line.
authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops4_b: You will need to add a block inside of the repeat loop to solve this puzzle.
authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops4_c: Don't forget to change the number of times the loop repeats.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.short_instructions: Time to fix the stairs!  Repeat this pattern **5** times so the artist can reach the top of the bushes.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.short_instructions: **Challenge:**  It's a hidden garden! Let's walk around.
https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.long_instructions: **Challenge:**  It's a hidden garden! Let's walk around.

authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops7_a: This challenge uses **4** loops, one right after another!
authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops7_b:
Notice that every loop makes a stair pattern that goes a different direction.

[][0]
authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops7_c:
The loops should do this:

-   Loop 1
    -   Right
    -   Down

-   Loop 2
    -   Right
    -   Up

-   Loop 3
    -   Left
    -   Up

-   Loop 4
    -   Left
    -   Down

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.short_instructions: Time to head home. Can you fix this ladder using only one block to help the artist get down?

authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops8_a: How many times should you repeat the pattern to make the ladder?
authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops8_b: Try running the code you're given to see what it does.

https://studio.code.org/s/pre-express-20.short_instructions: Let's take the short way home, over the pond. Can you help the artist stay on the stones?

authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops9_c: Can't figure out where to put the loop? Try writing the code step-by-step and look for a pattern.

authored_hints.courseB_artist_loops_challenge2_a: The code to draw an X is already given to you. All you need to do is repeat the X and `jump` to the next spot.
